title: Rear Brake Caliper - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Release the fixing and detach the rear wheel ABS sensor from the rear brake anchor plate. Collect the shim.
Disconnect the rear brake hose at the caliper and place the free end of the hose into a suitable container to collect the brake fluid. Discard the two sealing washers.
If the brake caliper is to be disassembled, loosen the two brake pad retaining pins.
If the brake caliper is to be disassembled, remove the brake pads and the anti-rattle spring.
